name: Smooth morphism
summary:
In algebraic geometry, a morphism 
  
    
      
        f
        :
        X
        →
        S
      
    
    {\displaystyle f:X\to S}
  
 between schemes is said to be smooth if

(i) it is locally of finite presentation
(ii) it is flat, and
(iii) for every geometric point 
  
    
      
        
          
            s
            ¯
          
        
        →
        S
      
    
    {\displaystyle {\overline {s}}\to S}
  
 the fiber 
  
    
      
        
          X
